Overview  eSpark Learning puts fun and effective learning experiences in the hands of more than a million K-5 students around the USA, and can be found in 1-in-4 schools. After back to back years of 40+% revenue growth, we are looking to apply this success to our engineering organization and  double  our size in the next year so that we can further accelerate the growth of the business. In light of this, we are excited for senior data scientists to join the team who can have profound impact on the success of the company (as both contributors and leaders), and more fully realize their own potential by taking on responsibilities that align with their interests and passions.  The Role  As a Senior Data Scientist, you’ll join our engineering organization, reporting to the Director of Engineering, and help develop the practice and growth of data science across the company, in turn making the lives of teachers, students, principals, and other eSparkers better through your efforts. You’ll get your hands dirty with data to surface insights from our product, while also having the opportunity to help build out our data science function from the beginning, helping us define how we’ll conduct experiments, analyses, and other forms of quantitative research for years to come. We welcome candidates at the senior level or above, and will adapt title accordingly with experience.  There are three tenets all members of the team are expected to hold and embody:   We carry a growth mindset and drive our own development.  We believe that we do our best work when collaborating closely with others.  We care more deeply about the problems we’re solving than how they’re solved.   We believe that excitement to learn, a readiness to work together collaboratively, and good scientific and technical fundamentals are more important to success at eSpark than past experience with specific technologies or methodologies — we are always ready to pair and to train new staff on the methods we use. The applications our students and teachers use are built with Elm and Typescript on the frontend and Ruby on Rails on the backend (all covered by tests), running on top of Docker and with data stored in MySQL and Redshift. In contrast, our data science technology is nascent, and actively being defined by the growing data functions at eSpark, including you.  Responsibilities  Use all of our data to generate insights across our chain-link of three stakeholders:  For students:  What behaviors are driving student learning? Why are certain learning resources more effective than others? What learning activities engage kids the most? The least? Are we serving all communities equitably?  For teachers:  What makes a teacher try eSpark with her class? What makes her stick around? How do eSpark usage and referrals spread within a school?  For administrators:  Which usage patterns in the classroom are predictive of a trial converting to a paid partnership? Do certain school attributes predict sales conversions?  Write software as needed to bridge the gap between the data we have and the data you need  Define and configure the tech stack for performant and reproducible analyses  Design and help build our experimentation platform  Support business goals by helping teachers find eSpark, sign up to use it in their classrooms, and advocate partnership to their administrators  Lead the experimental design around product and feature roll-outs  Participate in design and ideation around product and feature opportunities, using data to inform these decisions  Level up eSpark’s data science capabilities and knowledge across product, marketing, sales, and customer experience  Drive our understanding of the efficacy, equity, and fairness of our learning product for students of all backgrounds and circumstances  Participate in external research communities, and attend/publish work in academic and industry conferences like FaccT, COMPASS, WSDM, CIKM, KDD, AERA, NeurIPS, AIED, etc.   Benefits and Policies.  In addition to a competitive salary and stock options, eSpark offers full healthcare coverage (including vision, dental, and mental health benefits), generous vacation and parental leave policies. We are a fully-distributed company (circa March 2020) and provide benefits around outfitting your home-office arrangement, including your choice of technical equipment. We believe in work-life balance and respect nights and weekends.  The Interviews  The eSpark engineering team’s approach to interviewing is built on transparency, as we believe that everyone has a better, more productive experience when expectations are clear. For this role, we are looking for candidates who meet three specific criteria:   Self-sufficient scientist – You can design and implement analytic and experimental methods to answer important business questions independently, while leveraging the team for support.  Competent software engineer – You can write the code you need to gather and analyze the data for scientific work and develop and implement towards a vision for how this work can be done in a repeatable, reliable way into the future.  Capable strategic partner – You are quick to comprehend business and product context, allowing you to contribute to what we’re doing and why, with the ability to recognize and fill in the gaps as needed.   To learn about these three areas, and you in a general sense, we conduct three one-hour interviews with various teammates from eSpark, from engineering and beyond. We also ask for three references, to complete a full picture of you as a candidate. Written feedback or evaluations are also acceptable substitutes. We also recognize that not everyone has enjoyed a complete history of healthy working environments, and we are keen to work with you to identify appropriate individuals who can speak to your strengths and areas for growth.  For more context on our interview process, please refer to this document on Data Science Interviews at eSpark – What to Expect.  About eSpark  Vision.  Our vision is that every student, regardless of their circumstances or background, has the opportunity to set and realize an ambitious dream for themselves. Our mission is to re-imagine learning so it's student centered, enabling students to succeed in school and life.  Impact.  Our work makes a significant difference in students' lives. Independent testing data from public school districts across the country consistently show that students learn more in areas of personalized study with eSpark. One researcher from MIT, who evaluated an eSpark in Boston Public Schools, wrote: “I find strong positive, significant effects of eSpark for both math and English Language Arts (ELA). So the eSpark intervention, which is just 30 minutes a day, led to almost half the effect of a full year in a high performing charter school. I view these as very impressive gains. The findings made a substantial dent into the black-white achievement gap.”  Diversity.  At eSpark, we believe all people—adults and students alike—deserve respect for who they are. We work hard to make eSpark an environment in which everyone can thrive and succeed, supporting employees as individuals through people-centric management and as a company with our IDEA (Inclusion, Diversity, Equity, and Access) employee resource group. We believe it is critical that our team reflects the student populations we aim to serve.  Pandemic.  The 2020-2021 school year has been a time of unprecedented challenges for teachers, students, parents, and schools.  We believe — and have seen in last spring and fall — that eSpark’s personalized curriculum, made of fun and educational games and videos and adapted to each student; our commitment to providing teachers the tools and live support they need to support both remote and in-person learning; and our engaged team focused together on supporting educators and learners, can be a powerful help to teachers and to the students most at risk of falling behind during the pandemic.

About Opendoor: Founded in 2014, Opendoor’s mission is to empower everyone with the freedom to move. We believe the traditional real estate process is broken and our goal is simple: build a digital, end-to-end customer experience that makes buying and selling a home simple, certain and fast. We have assembled a dedicated team with diverse backgrounds to support more than 100,000 homes bought and sold with us and the customers who have selected Opendoor as a trusted partner in handling one of their largest financial transactions. But the work is far from over as we continue to grow in new markets. Transforming the real estate industry takes tenacity and dedication. It takes problem solvers and builders. It takes a tight knit community of teammates doing the best work of their lives, pushing one another to transform a complicated process into a simple one. So where do you fit in? Whether you’re passionate about real estate, people, numbers, words, code, or strategy - we have a place for you. Real estate is broken. Come help us fix it.   About the Role: As a Senior Data Scientist at Opendoor, you will build models that determine which homes we acquire, how much we should pay for them, and how these decisions impact our margin, growth, and customer satisfaction targets. You will also help us discover the value of the homes that we own, so we can resell them on the market quickly and for the right price. You will rapidly iterate on new approaches to solve pricing problems all the way from idea to execution to evolution. Getting these decisions right is essential to our success as we innovate in new areas of real estate.   Our Teams: Pricing Prediction  - Responsible for all the core pricing prediction models, but in particular OVM (which predicts the value of a specific home right now) and HPA (which predicts the value of homes over time). If algorithmic pricing is the heart of Opendoor, this is the heart of algorithmic pricing. Advanced Resale Optimization  - Our ARO team optimally acquires an individual home and, once it’s acquired, will optimally resell an individual home given supply-demand, tradeoffs, etc Portfolio Construction  - Responsible for driving portfolio-wide optimization, including margin vs. revenue tradeoff, allocate fixed resources (e.g. marketing $$) to different markets, managing portfolio-wide risk given HPA forecast, etc.  As a Senior Data Scientist, you will: Define the data strategy, including creating metrics with existing systems to understand our products and policies, and designing the next generation intelligent systems to improve our real estate pricing and operations practices Build models and policies to help teams achieve their business objectives Design experiments and conduct causal inference to determine effect of our initiatives Become a domain expert in real estate  We’re looking for teammates who have: 5+ years of industry experience with advanced degree in a quantitative field Expertise in statistical inference and machine learning modeling Proficiency in working with complex and fast-evolving data sets Experience in product analytics and experimental design Strong written and verbal communication skills to influence non-technical audiences with analytical insights Proficiency in SQL or any other database languages and numeric programming in Python, R or other languages  Bonus points if you have experience in the below areas: Fraud or incident detection Working with hardware and sensor data Time series analysis and forecasting Optimization under uncertainty and risk management  More About Us: Want to learn more about us and how we are revolutionizing the home buying and selling process? Learn more about us on our website, check out our profile on The Muse to learn more about our culture from our team members, or read our blog posts to hear about the work we are doing. We Offer the Following Benefits and Perks: Full medical, dental, and vision with optional 85% coverage for dependents Flexible vacation policy Generous parental leave Paid time off to volunteer Please note that these benefits and perks are available only to Full Time team members and do not apply to contract roles. Opendoor Values Openness: Our team celebrates our diverse backgrounds. We believe that being open about who we are and what we do allows us to be better. Individuals seeking employment at Opendoor are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or other protected status under all applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances. For California residents: for more information about the categories of personal information that we collect for recruiting purposes, please see our personnel Privacy Policy.

Lambda's mission is to accelerate human progress with computation. Our deep learning systems push advancements in quantum computing, cancer detection, autonomous aircraft, drug discovery, self-driving cars, and much more. Our customers include Apple, Intel, Microsoft, Amazon Research, Tencent, Kaiser Permanente, MIT, Harvard, Stanford, Caltech and the Department of Defense.  Our Machine Learning team's mission is to bring world-class ML expertise to our products and services. The team plays a significant role in Lambda’s consultancy arm - a group of engineers and researchers with deep experience in machine learning, software engineering, and computing infrastructure. We innovate on exciting new technologies to keep our services and our customers ahead of the competition.  About the Role  We are hiring a machine learning researcher to join a lean ML team. You will have a strong impact on Lambda’s applied ML research and consultancy services. Your main responsibilities are   Help the team to identify, implement and test technical solutions.  Prospect ideas for applied research projects and help the team to create IPs in the form of scalable services, licensable tools and custom models.  What You’ll Do  Contribute to our machine learning consultancy projects with applied research.  Conduct, document and reduce the turnaround cycle of our ML experiments. Present the findings to your peers and customers in a clear and concise manner.  Contribute to the development of scalable services, licensable tools and custom models.  Bring machine learning insights to our sales engineers and customers in the forms of technical blogs, benchmarks, or research publications.  Propose and lead your own research project.  You  Have an MS or PhD degree in EECS or related field, or equivalent work experience.  Are a highly effective team collaborator with strong communication skills.  Have a proven track record of optimizing state-of-the-art machine learning methods in terms of quality, speed, memory footprint or scalability.  Have a proven track record of managing large datasets and experiments.  Have a proven track record of writing reproducible ML code and significant contributions to open source projects.  Have knowledge of machine learning theory.  Have proficiency with Python and major ML frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.  Nice to have  Participated in research work published by major conferences/journals in ML or related fields.  Experience in running distributed ML jobs at scale, or very efficiently on custom edge devices.  Experience in CUDA programming  Experience in MLOps  Experience in full stack software development   About Lambda   We offer generous cash & equity compensation.  Investors include Gradient Ventures, Google’s AI-focused venture fund.  We are experiencing a high rate of growth and have 10x’d over the last 3 years.  Our research papers have been accepted into top machine learning and graphics conferences, including NeurIPS, ICCV, SIGGRAPH, and TOG.  We have a wildly talented team of 60, and are growing fast.  Our remote workforce, based on role, is across the U.S., with headquarters in San Francisco.  Health, dental, and vision coverage for you and your dependents.  Commuter/Work from home stipends.  401k Plan.  3 weeks Annual Paid Time Off.   A Final Note:  You do not need to match all of the listed expectations to apply for this position. We are committed to building a team with a variety of backgrounds, experiences, and skills.  Equal Opportunity Employer  Lambda Labs is an Equal Opportunity employer. Applicants are considered without regard to race, color, religion, creed, national origin, age, sex, gender, marital status, sexual orientation and identity, genetic information, veteran status, citizenship, or any other factors prohibited by local, state, or federal law.

job_title: Product Manager, Machine Learning User Experience Interface
job_Description: Product Machine Learning The Platform team creates the technology that enables Spotify to learn quickly and scale easily, enabling rapid growth in our users and our business around the globe. Spanning many disciplines, we work to make the business work; creating the frameworks, capabilities and tools needed to welcome a billion customers. Join us and help to amplify productivity, quality and innovation across Spotify. Location New York or Remote Americas Job type Permanent At Spotify, we want to create the best product that matches the perfect music at the perfect moment for our over 300 million users. Core to this mission is having an incredibly personalized platform for our customers and being able to recommend the most relevant content to surface in any context. This mission begins with Machine Learning. It is crafted from the insights and ideas our engineers generate from the data, buoyed by the connections they make with fellow specialists. Encouraging those connections and building a magical experience is our Machine Learning Platform mission, and we’re looking for a Product Manager to help drive these efforts. Collaborate with engineers, researchers, data scientists, designers and other product managers to craft the experience for Machine Learning practitioners across Spotify’s global offices. Enabling our ML experts to be successful at driving new initiatives and enhancing our world class music recommendation systems. The outputs of the teams building on top of our platform will connect the creators on Spotify’s platform to the rapidly growing global Spotify user base. What You'll Do Lead the product vision of ML Home, our Backstage plugin that unifies our ML platform components and helps teams across Spotify collaborate, discover, and observe ML powered products. Lead the strategy and roadmap for ML Home, incorporating an iterative product building approach that prioritizes impact and continuous feedback.. Work closely with internal research and production teams to better understand their use cases and create a Product Roadmap to meet their needs. Establish product metrics that reflect product success and the progress of users on the platform. Drive efforts that increase performance on these metrics and the user experience. Serve as a product evangelist for ML products internally and externally. Support ML education efforts and contribute to strategies that increase ML competence. Be a champion of an inclusive team environment, while inspiring your peers to perform at their sustainable peak. Who You Are You have 2+ years or more of product management experience and have experience defining product roadmaps – ideally for infrastructure or technical products. You have a high level understanding of the Machine Learning workflow, the terminology and the unique challenges associated with the domain You have strong empathy for your product users and obsessively champion their needs with your engineering team. You are a great teammate with a proven track record to work cross-functionally and establish relationships with customer teams. You have an appetite for responsibility but are willing to step back and support your team to achieve success. You enjoy the ability operate effectively and autonomously in situations of ambiguity, with only high-level direction. Where You'll Be We are a distributed workforce enabling our band members to find a work mode that is best for them! Where in the world? For this role, it can be within the Americas region in which we have a work location and is within working hours. Working hours? We operate within the Eastern Standard time zone for collaboration and ask that all be located in that time zone. Prefer an office to work from home instead? Not a problem! We have plenty of options for your working preferences. Find more information about our Work From Anywhere options here. Our global benefits Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse. Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success. Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents. All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub. Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs. Spotify On Tour, join your colleagues on trips to industry festivals and events. Learn about life at Spotify Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens. Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service with a community of more than 381 million users.

job_title: Senior Data Scientist, Core Data Science
job_Description: About us Kyte is a Series A technology platform that brings magic and seamless delivery into the experience of getting a car in cities. Ownership: You are a self-starter and are satisfied by owning large chunks of the product roadmap. Ambition: You are ridiculously ambitious and want to get the most out of your life. The School of Computing and Augmented Intelligence seeks a full-time staff member to serve on a multi-year contract for a collaborative project. This position will lead efforts to maintain a database of health-related data, conduct data analysis, report aggregate performance among project participants, provide analytical feedback to individual participants, and support efforts to improve outcomes.  This collaborative project is a partnership between the Arizona Health Care Cost Containment System (AHCCCS) and the AHCCCS Complete Care health plans to sponsor a Learning Collaborative (LC) for the provider groups participating in the Targeted Investments Program (TIP). The purpose of the LC is to optimize integration of primary care and behavioral health to maximize and sustain milestone performance by the provider groups and strengthen provider networks for successful value-based payment models in the future. This project will deliver timely actionable information and a performance management system featuring a forum to share best practices and disseminate the practical content needed to achieve the TIP core components and milestones.  Job Family  Business Operations Department Name  Sch Compt & Augmented Intellig  Full-Time/Part-Time  Full-Time VP Code  EXEC VP/PROVOST Scope of Search  Open Grant Funded Position  This is a grant funded position. Continuation is contingent on future grant funding.  Salary Range  $56,600 - $80,000 per year; DOE  Close Date  20-December-2021  Category  02  Essential Duties  Oversees secure collection, cleaning, standardization, transformation and storing of data from various sources. Maintains databases and related programs in a thorough and efficient manner, ensuring data quality. Identifies and uses appropriate investigative and analytical technologies to identify patterns, interpret and verify results. Uses predictive modeling, statistics, trend analysis and other data analysis techniques to explore data and to answer specific research questions. Collaborates with the team in order to improve the effectiveness of computational models through the use of data and feedback from stakeholders. May perform other duties as assigned. Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of. Lonza is seeking an experienced and motivated Associate Principal Scientist with a strong background in cheminformatics and data science to join the Small Molecules R&D team. He/She/They will broaden and deepen the Division’s capabilities in the development and application of R&D cheminformatics, with a focus on Preclinical CMC workflows. This role is integral to R&D’s mission to develop innovative technology platforms that accelerate the clinical readiness of our clients’ groundbreaking therapeutics. Our new colleague will be responsible for developing innovations in a broad range of cheminformatics areas, including – as non-limiting examples – complex molecule synthesis, reaction and process optimization, automation integration, and HTE experimentation and large scale data analysis. Key responsibilities: Leverages data search, retrieval, and modelling to accelerate CMC workflows, working collaboratively with Drug Substance (DS) and Drug Product (DP) R&D and Operations colleagues. Collaborates with technical and commercial stakeholders to uncover, validate, and prioritize areas for innovation in cheminformatics and data science Integrates information from a variety of disciplines (chemical synthesis and manufacturing; pharmaceutical sciences, opportunistically) and sources (technical and commercial) to uncover actionable insights and new Lonza IP. Leads technical and commercial stakeholders to data-driven decisions on the selection and internal use of state-of-the-art cheminformatics technologies, including augmentation of off-the-shelf cheminformatics solutions Develops methods and capabilities for archiving and retrieving data on molecular structures, reaction pathways, molecular interactions, and other pharmaceutically relevant phenomena. Identifies chemical property classifications and trends from large databases using mathematical and cheminformatics techniques. Trains and advises DS and DP R&D and Operations colleagues about the cheminformatics capabilities available to them – those newly developed in R&D and pre-existing. Promotes the benefits of Small Molecules’ cheminformatics and data science advances through publications (patents, peer-reviewed journal articles, technical marketing communications) and public speaking engagements (conference presentations, poster sessions, roundtables, etc.) Key requirements: PhD in Organic Chemistry, Cheminformatics, Computational Chemistry, or related scientific field with significant experience within pharmaceutical, fine chemicals, or biotechnology field.  -OR-  MS/MA in Organic Chemistry  and  MS Cheminformatics or MS Computational Science with significant years of experience within pharmaceutical, fine chemicals, or biotechnology field.  Candidates with combined experience in laboratory research settings (organic synthesis or method development) and cheminformatics or data science are strongly encouraged to apply. Experience Demonstrated cheminformatics expertise in areas such as applied AI and machine learning, chemical reaction/library enumeration, 2D/3D similarity, clustering, text-mining, dimensionality reduction techniques pertinent to data mining and data visualizations – with proven track record of accomplishments Strong fluency in at least one scientific scripting or programming language (e.g., R or Python) and at least one querying language (e.g., SQL) Proficiency with cheminformatics pipelining tools (e.g., KNIME) and leveraging toolkits, therein (e.g., RDKit, CDK, Erlwood, etc.) and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, DeepChem) Demonstrated understanding of critical assessment of molecule-property data, reaction process data, and predictive model quality. Essential skills Passion_ You love to draw unique insights in organic synthesis, process chemistry, and material science through the combination, normalization, and analysis of disparate data Entrepreneurial mindset_ You thrive on defining key challenges, innovative solutions,  and  the commercial benefits of research investments, to grow the company and team Great communication and presentations skills_ You enjoy telling stories with data, internally and externally. (Language proficiency in English and Deutsch.) Roll-up-your-sleeves Leadership_ You are happy to teach by demonstration as needed, and to individually contribute to achieve project success. Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically. People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference. Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

JOB DESCRIPTION At Levi Strauss & Co, we are revolutionizing the apparel business and redefining the way denim is made. We are taking one of the world’s most iconic brands into the next century: from creating machine learning-powered denim finishes to using block-chain for our factory workers’ wellbeing, to building algorithms to better meet the needs of our consumers and optimize our supply chain. Be a pioneer in the fashion industry by joining our global merchandise planning data science team, where you will have the chance to build exciting solutions that will impact our business and at the same time be part of a bigger, across-continents, data science community. As a Sr. Data Scientist, you will be instrumental in developing models that address specific business needs while being innovative and bringing cutting-edge research into production. About the job: The job responsibilities span over our entire lifecycle of data products and will include: Partner with stakeholders across the Global planning organization and own multiple roadmap workstreams to enable us to use advanced ML and DL techniques to solve complex retail problems Independently lead strategically important and large projects with a significant impact on future capabilities and success of the business. Build complex predictive models using ML and DL techniques with production quality code and jointly own complex data science workflows with the Data Engineering team Mentor and grow junior members of the team in building the best of the class solutions on their roadmap items. Continuously scan the Data Science landscape for recent developments and opportunities to integrate new methodologies into the existing project portfolio. Ensure that the risks associated with projects are raised proactively to ensure all projects stay on track About You: 7+ years of prior experience in a business-focused Data Scientist role 7+ years of hands-on experience analyzing data, drawing conclusions, defining recommended actions, building predictive models, and visualizing results. 6+ years of SQL development skills writing complex queries. 4+ years of experience with Python, R, Java, C++, Julia, or another widely used open-source programming language. 4+ years of experience deploying Machine Learning algorithms in a production environment. 4+ years’ experience in experience in Deep Learning engineering. 4+ years’ experience with distributed computing and data processing using tools like Kubernetes, Kafka, Spark & HIVE 4+ years of data visualization experience demonstrating ability to determine the appropriate visualization for a variety of data types and create compelling stories with data. (D3.js, R Shiny, Looker, Tableau or similar). Experience working with cloud environments: AWS and/or Azure and/or GCP cloud platforms. Experience in Reinforcement Machine Learning is a huge plus. Experience in the retail domain is a plus #LI-Remote/#LI-Hybrid EOE M/F/Disability/Vets LOCATION Remote - USA FULL TIME/PART TIME Full time Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.

About Extend: Extend is modernizing the $100 billion-per-year extended warranty and protection plan industry using cutting-edge technology, and top-notch customer service. After a $260M Series C financing round, we are ready to continue to scale our organization and grow beyond our $1.6B valuation. Our API-first solution allows any merchant to offer extended warranties and protection plans, both online and offline, while also providing a merchant's end customers with a vastly improved and modern support experience that eliminates many of the issues customers face today with legacy underwriters. We are a venture-backed startup based in downtown San Francisco that is led by founders who have previously had multiple successful exits. Extend is simplifying the technology stack for the extended warranty industry. About the Role: The Data Science Lead will manage and execute Data Science and Machine Learning development for use-cases across the company. In this role, you will drive to advance the Machine Learning & Advanced Analytics practices by working closely with the data, operations, sales, product and engineering teams, while tapping into the depths of your quantitative and technical expertise. This role will report to the Head of ML and Advanced Analytics.  What You'll Be Doing: Execute on the ML road map based on the business priorities. Manage multiple projects in parallel and oversee their timely completion from start to finish, setting goals and project milestones. Balance execution between quick returns for the company versus strategic technology that provides long-term competitive advantage. Partner with cross-functional teams such as data engineering, solution engineering, and DevOps to implement a world-class machine learning infrastructure and production environment. Champion a data- and ML-driven business through data science models that outperform state-of-the-art for the domain. Leading the processing and integration of disparate traditional and non-traditional data. Create new analyses, models, and/or tools that deliver insights that enable scalable growth, client experience and profitability. Mentor jr. data scientists to help them execute as well as reduce risk. Provide them training in ideation, methodologies, implementations. Co-lead cross-functional teams.  What We're Looking For: PhD in Statistics, Data Science, Econometrics, Computer Science, Operations Research, or related quantitative degree is preferred. Expert command of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, statistical modeling, state-of-the-art tools, and engineering best practices. Expert knowledge of data mining techniques and tools with Python, R, SQL, etc. is required. Cloud, Unix, Javascript experience is a plus. Expert proficiency interrogating relational data bases with SQL and with using, managing workload with distributed computing tools (Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, etc.). Experience processing and modeling with unstructured data. 4+ years of work experience in the data science, AI / ML, with fast growth startups, or top consulting background. Experience in retail or digital marketing preferred. Proven track record of delivering multiple data science projects spanning scoping, development, testing, implementation, and management. Excellent project management skills, with a proven track record of on-time and within-budget delivery.  Life at Extend: Working with a great team from diverse backgrounds in a collaborative and supportive environment. Competitive salary based on experience, with full medical and dental & vision benefits. Stock in an early-stage startup growing quickly. Unlimited vacation policy. 401(k) with Financial Guidance from Morgan Stanley.

job_Description: Data Analytics Scientist ( Job Number:   HAM000446 )  Honda Dev. and Mfg. of Am LLC  Description Data Analytics Scientist   Honda has a clear vision for the future in 2030, and it’s a joyful one. We are looking for people with the individual skills, courage, persistence, and dreams that will help us reach our future-focused goals. We are seeking diversity of thought and experience to drive innovation and help us make fully informed decisions.  In this role, you will be responsible for identifying data improvement areas, collaborating on solutions and building those solutions using a range of approved digital technologies. The Scientist will focus on growing the digital solutions that continuously improve processes, products, services, and software.   At Honda, our associates take pride in their responsibilities. A typical day for a Data Analytics Scientist will include:  Identifying improvement areas and creating a plan to close the gap  Presenting and articulating purpose of Digital Transformation to all levels of associates Advising and coaching leaders on how to adopt new ideologies to transform outcomes  Collaborating with and forming relationships with IT to encourage ecosystem realignment for business enablement  Collaborating with a team of digital problem-solvers to deliver consistent, data-driven business outcome  Developing standard procedures, inputs, and outputs for digital products  Gathering stakeholder feedback and buy-in to continuously improve processes and systems  Developing and providing solutions which could include automation of data entry, querying of databases, etc. to improve user experience and gain user efficiencies. (Tool examples: SQL, Python, Jupyter, Docker, Tableau, Squirrel, other open-source tools, etc.) Demonstrating application of advanced theory and analysis of tools and software to job related issues  Promoting programs throughout North America to drive collaboration and engagement  Identifying opportunities for process, system and analytics improvements which align with company needs and direction; developing activities to achieve strategic objectives  Ensuring alignment of all system projects to overall Company needs  We are looking for qualified people with diverse backgrounds and experiences, open minds, and a disciplined work ethic. To bring the future to Honda as a Data Analytics Scientist, you must have:  Qualifications  A Bachelor’s degree in Data Science/ Computer Science, Supply Chain, Purchasing or Technical field (i.e. IT, Engineering) or equivalent  Minimum 4 years’ experience in Data Science, Supply Chain, IT, or Purchasing   Knowledge and Skills Computer skills  Verbal, presentation, and written communication skills  Knowledge of system ownership; IS/IT; ability to lead a project; knowledge transfer, capability to learn, understand and ability to explain the system’s capability and process  Collaboratively design user-centric solutions  Ability to multitask and work with minimum supervision; ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines Ability to prioritize and work with limited direction  Ability to troubleshoot complex problems in a team-based work environment   Additional Position Information  Typical travel- 1-2 times per quarter 5-10 hours per week overtime   Total Rewards Competitive Base Pay Medical, Dental, Vision  Remote Work Opportunities Bonus Program 401K Program Honda Product Programs Company Car Program   Honda is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected factor.

job_title: Director Data Science, Emerging Areas Open to remote work, except the following locations: CO, SD, VT, and WV
job_Description: Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team  NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game. Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world's best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At Nike, it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game! Who are we looking for We are looking for a seasoned data science leader for our Emerging Areas Data Science team. This role will be responsible for building and leading a new data science team tasked with expanding the application of data and data science into additional areas of Nike’s business. Examples of emerging areas in the application of data and data science include digital product design, new retail experiences, and sports marketing. The goal is to lay the foundation for leveraging data and data science at scale within these spaces. What will you work on You will…  Investigate and come to deeply understand key parts of Nike’s business that could further leverage data and data science. Develop a vision and roadmap for data science projects in these areas.  Hire, onboard, and lead a small team of data scientists to make progress against that roadmap.  Partner closely with the Technology and Product Management teams, as well as other data science leaders at the company, to ensure that the foundational data, systems, and processes are in place to successfully execute data science projects in these areas.  Evaluate the evolving landscape of data science vendors and develop a position on which capabilities should be built in house and which should be licensed.  Be an inspirational thought leader within the broader analytics and data science communities at Nike.  Who will you work with You will be the leader of the Emerging Areas Data Science team, reporting to the Vice President of Consumer Data Science. Emerging Areas Data Science is part of Nike’s Consumer Data Science team and Insights and Analytics function. This means you will be a leader within the broader data science and analytics community at Nike, and help organize and participate in our data science labs, study groups, and team activities, and attend conferences.  What you bring An entrepreneurial mindset paired with the leadership skills to succeed at a large and established organization.  Experience hiring and mentoring exceptional data scientists.  Expert level knowledge of machine learning.  A history of successful execution of data science projects.  Experience communicating technical roadmaps to business leaders.  Experience developing strong partnerships with engineering and product teams.   NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Please contact us to request accommodation.  Open to remote work, except cannot work in Colorado, South Dakota, Vermont, and West Virginia. These candidates will be required to relocate.  Nike requires all applicants for this position to be vaccinated for COVID-19 as a condition of hire. As an equal opportunity employer, Nike will make accommodations to individuals who cannot be vaccinated in accordance with applicable law.
